result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

MINUTES FROM CASE 15CF205:
Case called at 3:12 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Luke J. McGowan in court with Attorney David Westrick. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Court so finds
Atty Westrick informs the Court that they will not be accepting the State's offer and only intend to enter a plea at this time

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-15CF205; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #
2-15CF205
On Motion of the State, the Court dismiss outright Case 15CM164 - Court finds victim rights compliance in this matter
On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Case 15CM93 - Court finds victim rights compliance in this matter
Atty Westrick requests that the Court set out sentencing as far out as the Court will allow; Court cancels trial
off-record for scheduling: 3:27 - 3:29 pm
Court announces date for the record
Recess: 3:29 pm

Defendant Luke J. McGowan in court with Attorney David Robert Westrick.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. McGowan. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Atty. Westrick indicates that there is an additional case and will be requesting Discovery from the State; requests a PTC to discuss global resolution of cases. 

The Court notes that the Court has signed the Dismissal of Case 15CM164 and therefore will take no further action on this case and does NOT call this case.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

Cases 15CM93 and 15CM164 called together at 1:39-pm. [mo]
Judge Koschnick presiding for Branch II Intake 
Defendant Luke J. McGowan appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (For Bond Purposes Only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Zarwell indicates that Mr. McGowan is not eligible for PD representation.

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to Counsel given; The Court directs Atty. Zarwell to provide Mr. McGowan with the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Atty. Zarwell updates Mr. McGowan's address to Bayfield Court in Jefferson. 


The Court requires a $5000  signature bond to cover both 15CM93 and 15CM164, with conditions:
--No Contact with Jerome Ehrke or Nadine or Michael Lecture
--No contact with Jessica Boeve or S.D.S.
--No presence at any residence which Jessica Boeve or S.D.S reside
--no possession of syringes or hypodermic needles without medical documentation
--no possession of illegal drugs
--no presence at any unattended roadside stands

recess 1:50 pm.

Conflict Review Worksheet

[MK] case called at 3:19pm. 
Defendant Luke J. McGowan not in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, then-DA Wambach had involvement in the prosecution of cases against Mr. McGowan.  The Court recognizes the name, however the Court does not recall Mr. McGowan. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
On Motion of DA Happ, the Court orders issuance of a Probable Cause Warrant. 
recess 3:24pm.
